individual_metadata.synopsis: Voss waits in the sewers until you get the hammer. Then he's there with the dragon he rode in Act1 in humanoid form. If you show him the hammer then, he rewards you with a Silver Sword and then leaves to meet you in endgame.He will still be in endgame even if you didn't do this step, but you just would have missed on the Silver Sword.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to Voss when he's in the sewers after Sharess Caress. You have to not have signed the pact with Raphael and gotten the quest from Voss to obtain the hammer in another way.

6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
6.text: Have you brought the Orphic Hammer?

8.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
8.text: Find a way into the Astral Prism and use the Orphic Hammer to free the True Heir.

57.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
57.text: Orpheus' cry will shake the planes, and I will fly to your side.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: Kith'rak Voss. May the Astral Sea be still as you cross it.
49.context: NodeContext: Just an aphorism, as in 'May the road rise up to meet you.'

35.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
35.text: And may your mind be of steel so your blade may be of silver, T'lak'ma Ghir.

0.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
0.text: Have you retrieved the Orphic Hammer? Will our prince's chains finally be broken?

5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
5.text: Have you retrieved the Orphic Hammer? Will our prince's chains finally be broken?

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Any idea where I might find the Hammer?

53.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
53.text: A devil of Raphael's stature does not simply make camp on the shores of the Styx.

64.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
64.text: He will have made a sanctuary for himself. A lavish one, too, one that caters to his many vices.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: The House of Hope. We must find a way in.

44.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
44.text: The House of Hope, you say? I couldn't ask for a name more fitting.

11.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
11.text: He must keep the Orphic Hammer there.

61.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
61.text: Every house has an entrance, istik - even those in the Hells. A diabolist in this very city might know the way.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I haven't recovered the Hammer just yet.

40.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
40.text: Then I will wait here until you have. The chains that bind Orpheus also bind the whole of the githyanki people.

39.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
39.text:
'The Prince of the Comet is not dead.
The Prince of the Comet will come again.
The Prince of the Comet will liberate us from the lich queen's tyranny.'

14.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
14.text: The prophecy is one step closer to fruition.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: Gith's son will soon ride against Vlaakith, Voss. And I will follow him into battle.

46.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
46.text: And you will wield the greatest gift Mother Gith ever granted her dauntless children.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss leans forward to give player a silver sword, doesn't need to be shown beyond a lean.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: I will carry it for the honour of Gith, the great liberator - and her unforgotten son.

52.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
52.text: Among the githyanki, one gift is esteemed above all others. The silver sword.

60.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
60.text: Take it. Wield it in honour of Gith, the great liberator - and her unforgotten son.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss leans forward to give player a silver sword, doesn't need to be shown beyond a lean.

30.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
30.text: Istik, now that you have the Hammer you must find a way to enter the Astral Prism.

59.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
59.text: Once inside, smash Orpheus' bonds. His cry will shake the planes, and I will fly to your aid.

20.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
20.text: The Prince of the Comet will sear the heavens again. First we'll defeat the Absolute. Then we let the lich queen tremble!

16.text: Think again. I will not permit your entry.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: You need to let me into the Prism.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Is there any way I can convince you?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'll find a way to free Orpheus from your clutches.

3.text: Even if you could, you would relinquish your mind to the elder brain in so doing.

56.text: When I am done with the gith princeling, you may do with him as you like. But not a moment before.

45.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
45.text: Questions, istik? You seem to be lost in thought.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Getting into the Astral Prism will be complicated.

55.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
55.text: Yes. But you will meet this challenge, as you've met so many others.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Orpheus sensed the tadpole before, and his guard attacked. Won't he attack if we free him?

21.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
21.text: The Prince of the Comet aches for githyanki liberation more than he abhors ghaik.

19.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
19.text: He might seethe when you free him. He might gnash his teeth and slander your name.

26.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
26.text: But he will see reason. I promise you.

65.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
65.text: Istik, friend to Orpheus. Together, we will end the elder brain which shakes this city. Then, I turn my sights to Vlaakith, the queen of deceit.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Who is this new companion of yours?

12.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
12.text: Not a new companion, but an old one - and a loyal one.

42.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
42.text: A proper introduction is in order. But I will let him do the honours.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Where are the rest of your allies?

7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
7.text: The remaining honour guard serve as my eyes and ears.

18.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
18.text: Vlaakith's forces hunt you and the Prism. My allies have slayed more than you know, so that you might travel freely.

63.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
63.text: As for those that break through, you've proven more than capable of bleeding them yourself.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'm here for your head, traitor.
